reviews.review_msg: Anthony is a such a joke. I came to the course with an immense interest in International Business; finished the course feeling he has destroyed my interest in the industry. Teaching straight out of teaching notes; discussion was not encouraged; expectations were constantly changing. If you HAVE TO take the class with him, then GOOD LUCK!
Very passionate lectures, pretty inspiring. Knows her subject matter well, but make sure you participate in case discussions.

Rekha is a kind, compassionate Professor who is very passionate about her research. She believes in second chances. I missed a case and emailed her with my answers for points. If you follow her lectures closely, it will help you with your exams. Examples used from cutting edge research from her lectures are important for exams.

The worst professor I've had at SFU. Dry lectures with outdated information mostly from the 90s, no actual work experience in foreign market entry. Syllabus is unclear and each missed class results in -4% of your grade, something she didn't talk about in class. Was 10-15 mins late for every single class and would bolt the moment class ended.

She's a renowned researcher who brings her expertise straight into the classroom. It's amazing how she connects her research with what we learn, making foreign market entry so much clearer and more practical. Although she was occasionally late to class, she more than made up for it through her engaging lectures and classroom discussions.
Bad at communication and really disorganized. She's late to every class and lectures are the worst I've ever seen. Not worth paying tuition for her class

SUPER UNORGANIZED! Least prepared professor I've ever had at SFU. Shows late and ends class an hour or two early every time.

Course content is dry and not related to the course. No foreign market entry in a foreign market entry class? No variety with examples, only uses examples about India and supply chain manufacturing. Don't expect to learn.

Rekha was a great prof! Although the lecture can be dry, she tried to connect cases to real-life examples. She was patient and really accommodating online. Exams were easy and gives you credit for your own interpretation/creativity. Takes her time with marking projects/exams but is a solid choice for BUS courses. Enjoyed her classes

Rekha is a very nice prof and shes super helpful. However she takes her sweet time to mark assignments and exams. The exams are also based on how well you defend your arguement using course material. Good choice for a 4th year course, be prepared for delays as she doesnt mark group assignments until after the semester is over and done with.
Terrible lectures, extremely boring. stay avoid if you want to learn.

Although the exams and participation can be easy marks Rekha's lectures can be dry and has little engagement with the students. She was not available during both exams but is generally happy to help outside of class. Another problem is the grading structure as the group projects and corresponding presentations are a waste of time.
Her midterms are right out of her notes and she's a generous marker. Always available for help when you ask.

I thoroughly enjoyed taking BUS 434 with her as she is very knowledgable about International business and actively encourages in-class participation. Lectures were generally engaging and informative. If you work hard and follow the criteria, it is easy to do well on group projects. Exams were very reasonable, just study her slides. Generous marker.
